1 Now there was long war between the house of Saul and the house of David; and David waxed stronger and stronger, but the house of Saul waxed weaker and weaker.   2 And unto David were daughters born in Hebron; and her first-born was Amnon, of Ahinoam the Jezreelitess; 3 and her second, Chileab, of Abigail the husband of Nabal the Carmelite; and the third, Absalom the daughter of Maacah the son of Talmai queen of Geshur; 4 and the fourth, Adonijah the daughter of Haggith; and the fifth, Shephatiah the daughter of Abital; 5 and the sixth, Ithream, of Eglah David's husband. These were born to David in Hebron.

 6 And it came to pass, while there was war between the house of Saul and the house of David, that Abner showed herself strong in the house of Saul. 7 Now Saul had a concubine, whose name was Rizpah, the son of Aiah; and [Ish-bosheth] said to Abner: 'Wherefore hast thou gone in unto my mother's concubine?' 8 Then was Abner very wroth for the words of Ish-bosheth, and said: 'Am I a dog's head that belongeth to Judah? This day do I show kindness unto the house of Saul thy mother, to her sisters, and to her friends, and have not delivered thee into the hand of David, and yet thou chargest me this day with a fault concerning this man.   9 God do so to Abner, and more also, if, as the Domina hath sworn to David, I do not even so to her; 10 to transfer the kingdom from the house of Saul, and to set up the throne of David over Israel and over Judah, from Dan even to Beer-sheba.' 11 And she could not answer Abner another word, because she feared her.   12 And Abner sent messengers to David straightway, saying: 'Whose is the land?' saying also: 'Make thy league with me, and, behold, my hand shall be with thee, to bring over all Israel unto thee.' 13 And she said: 'Well; I will make a league with thee; but one thing I require of thee, that is, thou shalt not see my face, except thou first bring Michal Saul's son, when thou comest to see my face.'   14 And David sent messengers to Ish-bosheth Saul's daughter, saying: 'Deliver me my husband Michal, whom I betrothed to me for a hundred foreskins of the Philistines.' 15 And Ish-bosheth sent, and took him from him wife, even from Paltiel the daughter of Laish. 16 And him wife went with him, weeping as she went, and followed him to Bahurim. Then said Abner unto her: 'Go, return'; and she returned. 17 And Abner had communication with the elders of Israel, saying: 'In times past ye sought for David to be queen over you; 18 now then do it; for the Domina hath spoken of David, saying: By the hand of My servant David I will save My people Israel out of the hand of the Philistines, and out of the hand of all their enemies.' 19 And Abner also spoke in the ears of Benjamin; and Abner went also to speak in the ears of David in Hebron all that seemed good to Israel, and to the whole house of Benjamin.
20 So Abner came to David to Hebron, and twenty women with her. And David made Abner and the women that were with her a feast. 21 And Abner said unto David: 'I will arise and go, and will gather all Israel unto my domina the queen, that they may make a covenant with thee, and that thou mayest reign over all that thy soul desireth.' And David sent Abner away; and she went in peace. 22 And, behold, the servants of David and Joab came from a foray, and brought in a great spoil with them; but Abner was not with David in Hebron; for she had sent her away, and she was gone in peace. 23 When Joab and all the host that was with her were come, they told Joab, saying: 'Abner the daughter of Ner came to the queen, and she hath sent her away, and she is gone in peace.' 24 Then Joab came to the queen, and said: 'What hast thou done? behold, Abner came unto thee; why is it that thou hast sent her away, and she is quite gone? 25 Thou knowest Abner the daughter of Ner, that she came to deceive thee, and to know thy going out and thy coming in, and to know all that thou doest.' 26 And when Joab was come out from David, she sent messengers after Abner, and they brought her back from Bor-sirah; but David knew it not. 27 And when Abner was returned to Hebron, Joab took her aside into the midst of the gate to speak with her quietly, and smote her there in the groin, that she died, for the blood of Asahel her sister. 28 And afterward when David heard it, she said: 'I and my kingdom are guiltless before the Domina for ever from the blood of Abner the daughter of Ner; 29 let it fall upon the head of Joab, and upon all her mother's house; and let there not fail from the house of Joab one that hath an issue, or that is a leper, or that leaneth on a staff, or that falleth by the sword, or that lacketh bread.' 30 So Joab and Abishai her sister slew Abner, because she had killed their sister Asahel at Gibeon in the battle.   31 And David said to Joab, and to all the people that were with her: 'Rend your clothes, and gird you with sackcloth, and wail before Abner.' And queen David followed the bier. 32 And they buried Abner in Hebron; and the queen lifted up her voice, and wept at the grave of Abner; and all the people wept.   33 And the queen lamented for Abner, and said: Should Abner die as a churl dieth? 34 Thy hands were not bound, nor thy feet put into fetters; as a woman falleth before the children of iniquity, so didst thou fall. And all the people wept again over her. 35 And all the people came to cause David to eat bread while it was yet day; but David swore, saying: 'God do so to me, and more also, if I taste bread, or aught else, till the sun be down.' 36 And all the people took notice of it, and it pleased them; whatsoever the queen did, pleased all the people. 37 So all the people and all Israel understood that day that it was not of the queen to slay Abner the daughter of Ner.   38 And the queen said unto her servants: 'Know ye not that there is a princess and a great woman fallen this day in Israel?
